name: Measuring  the Impact  of Using Web3
description:
How do we know that the use of web3 actually helped a social impact project make an impact? To qualify for this grant you have to propose a methodology to measure the social impact gains or losses from integrating web3 into your project. Choose and use Key Performance Indicators (KPIâ€™s) to measure each web3 integration point of your hackathon project, and describe how you will use them to demonstrate if web3 is supporting the project or hurting it.

For example, consider a project that is creating a dApp for reporting and rescuing dangerous snakes from a suburb in Florida. This project issues a token for snakes that are rescued and relocated while also raising funds using the dApp. They could create KPIs for:
- Funds raised in crypto
- Funds raised in fiat
- Number of unique donors in crypto
- Number of unique donors in fiat
- Number of MAU that login with web3
- Number of MAU that login with web2 sign in
- Market Cap of the token
- Number of snakes rescued by app
- Number of snakes rescued by government officials
- Amount of donations spent via the app
- Amount of taxes spent from the government
- Number of reports given via the app
- Number of reports given via calling 911
- Average response time and success rate via the app
- Average response time and success rate via government officials

How you interpret these KPIs is important. For example, did the number of snake reports on the dApp decrease because there are less snakes in the area, or because the web3 login is malfunctioning? This bounty will be awarded to the project that proposes the best methodology for measuring the actual impact (positive or negative) that integrating web3 enabled. This methodology is not considering just the overall impact of the project, but rather the impact of using web3 in each layer of the project. BONUS: The winner of this bounty will also have the opportunity to collaborate with social impact experts who are actively working on developing similar measurement models for various international institutions (the UN, World Bank, etc.), national governments and NGOsâ€™.
acceptanceCriteria:
-KPIs should be Specific, Measurable, Accessible, Reliable and Time Bound. We know that each of these criteria will not be completely addressed in your responses but the more the better.
-Nice to have Identifying the data source for each KPI, as in the source of the data used by the KPI to measure performance.

name: Quantifying the Qualitative Impact
description:
Quantifying the qualitative impact nonprofits create is a huge challenge, but projects that crack this nut will unlock incredible opportunities to change the way society coordinates around public goods. Is your project on that path? How do we measure and track the impact of free addiction counseling, planting a tree, or fixing a pothole?

The Ethereum community has produced several open source tools that do this:
- Quadratic Funding
- Praise
- Hypercerts
- Pairwise
- Conviction Voting
- And more!

Integrating these techniques in a creative way that quantifies a social impact that was before qualitative will be enough to qualify for this bounty, but the project that wins this bounty will likely go above and beyond that. There is a lot of interesting research in the resources section that may give you hints on how to address this bounty in a more novel way, potentially even creating a new mechanism.
acceptanceCriteria:
- Must output a quantifiable impact measurement for a qualitative impact, an NFT Badge is not enough, unless it is in some way quantifiable/rankable/measurable.
- Just tracking an already straight forward quantifiable metric will not be enough to qualify for this bounty.
- Must integrate web3 into the solution Nice to have
- Integrate other known coordination mechanisms, like Quadratic Funding, Praise, Hypercerts, Pairwise or ideally, create a new one ;-D
- Integrate quantifiable metrics alongside qualitative metrics.
- The impact measurement helps to align the project with its mission and values.
- The impact measurement is integrated into decision-making processes.
- The impact measurement is transparently communicated to stakeholders.
